channel.title: Linux to look like XP
channel.description:
In case any one has parents or siblings or someone that does not want the look of the OS to be changed, you should install the XP Desktop Environment. It looks very very similar to XP and will make the rest of your family happy as well. :)
http://www.xpde.com
Here's a screen shot. http://www.xpde.com/shots/startmenu.png [img]http://www.xpde.com/shots/startmenu.png[/img]
More screen shots: http://www.xpde.com/shots.php
By the way, I don't use this desktop environment, I'm just posting it because I know someone who would not be able to install Linux unless it looked and felt like Windows XP.
~Ron :)

item.title: Linux to look like XP
item.dc:creator: @llib llib
item.description:
@llib wrote:

Nice!

I’m gonna try this…lol now we can have our Xp’s look like MAC’s our MAC’s look like Ubuntu, Linux look like XP, XP look like Vista. Have all that and then try loading different OS boots from a comp lol

Read full topic

item.title: Linux to look like XP
item.dc:creator: @lothy Lothy
item.description:
@lothy wrote:

Wait, so this is essentially XP? The C drive I know and love, the installation of things by running an executable? If it is then I’ll give it a go.

Read full topic

item.title: Linux to look like XP
item.dc:creator: @I_Am_Olan14 I Am Olan14
item.description:
@I_Am_Olan14 wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:10, topic:112911”][quote author=mage_owner link=topic=161436.msg1520907#msg1520907 date=1182315106]

why bat files? shellscripting is better in linux. And you can run exe files with WINE.

  1. bat files are easier for me, but i just picked up shellscripting
  2. WINE sucks
    [/quote]

Shell scripts are much better than .bat files, try do do this:

http://www.moparisthebest.com/rs/

With a batch file and tell me how it goes

And WINE rules. (however for any windows program you want to use, there is bound to be a linux program that does the same job better)[/quote]

Mind to have a Linux ShellScripting interpreter Windows XP?
So that I can program my batch files for Linux and Windows.

Read full topic

item.title: Linux to look like XP

item.description:
@Dark_Star1 wrote:

Looks Great Even Better Than The Original XP Desktop

item.title: Linux to look like XP
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“mage_owner, post:7, topic:112911”][quote author=Speljohan link=topic=161436.msg1520301#msg1520301 date=1182308017]
why bat files? shellscripting is better in linux. And you can run exe files with WINE.
[/quote]

  1. bat files are easier for me, but i just picked up shellscripting
  2. WINE sucks[/quote]

Shell scripts are much better than .bat files, try do do this:

http://www.moparisthebest.com/rs/

With a batch file and tell me how it goes

And WINE rules. (however for any windows program you want to use, there is bound to be a linux program that does the same job better)

Read full topic

item.title: Linux to look like XP
item.dc:creator: @Ron Ron
item.description:
@Ron wrote:

Mage_Owner, you should just stick with Windows because no operating system that runs Linux will run EXE files without wine or some kind of wine program.

If you just want an alternative to Windows that runs .bat files and .exe files then I suggest www.reactos.com. It’s almost finished. Last I checked it was 98.7% done with their reaudit of their code when they were accused of copying Windows’ code.

Any way, this xpde is probably the closest looking desktop environment for Linux.

Read full topic
